review: I'm rarely on top of trends in electronics, but I use Amazon a lot to buy anything and everything, so they got me when they were plugging it on their home page for pre-orders. I did a little research and it all said the Fire Stick was promising, so I pre-ordered it and waited. The wait was well worth it. My only reservation at the time of buying it was that it didn't have HBO Go, but Amazon promised that it would be available within a year, and it was available well within that time. The screen format is so much easier to use than Roku, which was what I had before. I am an AmazonPrime member, so it is linked to my account which is really nice and convenient. I don't rent videos often (I think I've rented 2), but downloading and accessing apps, music, and those 2 videos is much easier now. And it's so small, so what's not to like about that. Make sure you have a designated spot for remotes though, otherwise the Fire Stick remote will get lost in the couch cushions before you know it.

review: The fire Stick is alright.  I have nothing currently to compare it to..other than..YES..it is cheaper than cable. I would say for the price it may be worth it, but if it crashes again I am sure to try another brand.
